Posts.Content: On Sep 13, 2017 6:18 PM ChaseNH wrote: I am newly diagnosed with invasive ductal breast cancer in my right breast, 1.1cm tumor or lesion or whatever you call it. My doctor has given me the option of mastectomy (single or double with reconstruction) or lumpectomy with 3 weeks radiation (Canadian protocol) and 5 years of Arimidex. I decided to go with the lumpectomy, but now I reading horrible things about the medication and the radiation. I am booked for an October 4th surgery. I am wondering if I have made a mistake. The doctor clearly was encouraging the lumpectomy, but did say it was my choice and not to worry--insurance would pay for it and my quality of life and prognosis numbers would be virtually identical. I am confused. This may get to you later than your surgery decidion. Here it is. My name is Annmarie. In 2003 I was diagnosed with breast cancer on my left breast. I was given the choice of a lumpectomy and mastectomy (single). I decided that my best option was a lumpectomy. I was to be 5 years on tamoxifen. I did 2 years on tamoxifen because it has a tendency of causing bladder cancer after 5 years.  After the lumpectomy and decided to learn alternative/holistic medicine.  I need it to  have something to use for prevention and western medicine does not offer that but holistic medicine does on many platforms. I decided to go to school and get my degree on holistic health.  Today I am able to help many people. My decision was the best I've ever made. It has been 14 years and I am still cancer free! and I will continue to be cancer free! Annmarie F,  HHP
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy v. Mastectomy
